intro: Ribes heteromorphum, commonly known as the Pacific gooseberry, is a shrub native to western North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other species of gooseberries and currants. The plant is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves that vary in shape along the stem, giving it its species name *heteromorphum*. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in clusters and are followed by edible, yellow berries. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas along the Pacific coast.
